alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Greene; Polk; Webster (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 15 at 5:21PM CDT until May 15 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN DALLAS, NORTHERN GREENE, SOUTHERN POLK AND NORTHWESTERN WEBSTER COUNTIES... At 521 PM CDT, Trained weather spotters reported that Woodstock road was unpassable 2 miles west northwest of Olive due to heavy rainfall from thunderstorms. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Buffalo, Strafford, Willard, Ash Grove, Fair Grove, Walnut Grove, Pleasant Hope, Morrisville, Olive, Foose, Brighton, Bassville, March, Ebenezer, Elkland, Glidewell, Charity, Sacville, Cave Springs, Eudora and Long Lane. This includes the following low water crossings... Cabin Creek at Cabin Creek Road, Niangua River at Highway Y, Turkey Creek at Highway W, Slagle Creek at 86 Road, Givins Branch at Highway W, Asher Creek at 560 Road and Opposum Creek at Bannon Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
